Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: HINCKLEY PARK_ WATLING STREET_ BURBAGE_ HINCKLEY_ LE10 3JA FLOORPLAN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Hinckley Park is strategically located adjacent to the M69 and 6.5 and 9.5 miles from the M6 and M1 respectively. The park is just a short drive from Leicester and Coventry and within an hour’s drive of Birmingham and East Midlands Airports and BIFT and Hams Hall railports. The site is well positioned for easy and quick access to a number of the UK’s major car manufacturing plants, making it perfect for “just in time” deliveries.

The 18 acre site is capable of accommodating a total of 450,000 sq ft and has a significant power supply. The site is reserved for B1 (light industrial) and B2 (general industrial) occupiers seeking bespoke design and build solutions.

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: _D_B_ LEICESTER DISTRIBUTION PARK_ SUNNINGDALE ROAD_ LEICESTER_ LE3 1UR FLOORPLAN

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: 1 per 10,000 sq ft Dock Loading Doors

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Situated 4 miles to the west of Leicester city centre and less than a mile from the M1 within the Braunstone industrial area, Leicester Distribution Park benefits from easy access to the UK’s main North / South corridor and the motorway network beyond. As an established manufacturing and logistics location, Leicester offers an extensive and cost-effective labour pool plus the central UK location makes this an unrivalled choice for local, national and international businesses.

Build to suit opportunities of up to 150,000 sq ft at LEDP, a 45 acre prime industrial, distribution and logistics site at the heart of the Golden Triangle. Units can be delivered within 12 months, offering a contemporary building design with prominent tenant signage zones, opportunities for bespoke requirements to be incorporated and transport office and driver welfare facilities to larger units.

address.Common.Line1: Segro Logistics Park East Midlands Gateway

Common.PostalAddresses.Common.Line1: Segro Logistics Park East Midlands Gateway

Common.FloorPlans.Common.ImageCaption: SEGRO LOGISTICS PARK EAST MIDLANDS GATEWAY FLOORPLAN

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
SEGRO Logistics Park East Midlands Gateway (SLPEMG) is a 700 acre development with planning consent for up to 6,000,000 sq ft of logistics accommodation. The development incorporates a 50 acre Strategic Rail Freight Interchange (SRFI) which will include a rail freight terminal, capable of handling up to sixteen 775m freight trains per day, container storage and HGV parking.

SLPEMG is centrally located in the Midlands, adjacent to East Midlands Airport, with direct access to J24 of the M1. Nottingham is 13 miles to the north east, Leicester 20 miles to the south and Derby is 14 miles to the north west.

Extensive infrastructure works are currently underway. These works include: improvements to junction 24 and junction 24A of the M1 including the introduction of a smart motorway system by Highways England, safer access to the A50 at Lockington and Hemington and a new Kegworth by-pass.

The rail terminal will connect the site to the Castle Donington freight line, providing direct access to the major UK ports, the channel tunnel and other UK / air freight interchanges.

The proximity to communities, including the three cities of Leicester, Derby and Nottingham also ensures a healthy supply of labour.

Building specifications can be tailored to meet individual occupational requirements. Plots available from 100,000 sq ft to 3,000,000 sq ft for immediate development with fast track delivery.

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: SEGRO LOGISTICS PARK EAST MIDLANDS GATEWAY DERBY DE74 2DL
SEGRO LOGISTICS PARK EAST MIDLANDS GATEWAY WAREHOUSE INTERIOR

Dynamic.PrimaryImage.Common.ImageCaption: SEGRO LOGISTICS PARK EAST MIDLANDS GATEWAY DERBY DE74 2DL

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
SLPEMG is centrally located within the UK industrial and logistics market, offering immediate access to the UK’s motorway network as well as dedicated on-site rail and air freight terminal with a direct link to Felixstowe and Southampton.

 An exciting opportunity to be part of a 700-acre vibrant and active logistics park with a diverse mix of customers, including Games Workshop, DHL, XPO Logistics, Amazon and Kuehne+Nagel.

 Delivering a speculatively developed building of 220,000 sq ft (20,240 sq m) at the successful SEGRO Logistics Park East Midlands Gateway.
